instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U6100: What is U6100? this is an SPI ROM chip that holds the BIOS which is necessary for the machine to POST or try and power on..
definitions.PPVCC_S0_CPU: What is PPVCC_S0_CPU? The "PPVCC_S0_CPU" power rail is responsible for supplying power to the CPU when the MacBook is fully on, or in the S0 state. This rail is one of the main voltages that the CPU requires for operation. .
definitions.U1950: What is U1950? This chip often becomes corroded on pin 8 on the PP3V42_G3H pin causing PM_SLP_S4_L to go missing.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a fan spin, no chime, no display
threads.message:
Liquid spill, corrosion around <CHIP>U6100</CHIP>, everywhere else looks perfect.
Originally no boot, after removing <CHIP>U6100</CHIP>, cleaning pin 7 and replacing, it turns on, has vcore, gets warm, fan spins normally, will turn on and off with power button.
No chime no display, no backlight

<CHIP>U6100</CHIP> replaced from donor board - twice.
diode mode with <CHIP>U6100</CHIP> removed is
1-0.609
2-0.450
3-0.515
4-0.000
5-0.389
6-0.518
7-0.475
8-0.475

so far i have replaced <CHIP>U6101</CHIP> and <CHIP>U1900</CHIP>. removed j6100

Not sure where to go from here.

threads.message: Where did you take <CHIP>U6100</CHIP> from? You cannot just change them between boards, put back original.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a fan spin, no chime, no display
threads.message: Originally i replaced the same chip after cleaning pin 7, when that had the result i described above i replaced with another from the same model <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a donor. Same result

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a fan spin, no chime, no display
threads.message: At least put back original chip and check all resistors in serie with data lines <RESISTOR>R6110</RESISTOR> and up 18 of them. Also the traces between them.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a fan spin, no chime, no display
threads.message: Replaced original <CHIP>U6100</CHIP>, checked all resistors between <RESISTOR>R6110</RESISTOR> and <RESISTOR>R6133</RESISTOR>, all fine, traces between them have 0.000v voltage drop along them, only traces to smc and cpu i could not measure

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a fan spin, no chime, no display
threads.message: Pin 8 of <CHIP>U1950</CHIP> corroded? Was there crap around <CHIP>U1900</CHIP>?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a fan spin, no chime, no display
threads.message: pulled and checked <CHIP>U1950</CHIP>, looks fine, liquid didn't look to make it as far as <CHIP>U1900</CHIP> but i pulled and replaced anyway.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a fan spin, no chime, no display
threads.message: Out of ideas. Check all resistors and traces to <CHIP>U6100</CHIP> again, there are 20 or so of them in that circuit.
